oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mast of the USS Maine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of the mast of the USS Maine. Handwritten on back of photograph, "Wreck of the 'Maine.'"

On February 15, 1898, the USS Maine, an armored cruiser stationed in Havana Harbor to protect American interests during the Cuban independence movement, exploded and sank, killing approximately 260 of the 400 crew on board. The tragedy escalated tensions between the United States and Spain and precipitated the outbreak of the Spanish-American War.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Maine (Battleship); Shipwrecks; Spanish-American War, 1898--Causes;
Ships; Shipwrecks; Marine accidents
